item.title: Dark Souls 3 Boss Beat Using a Saxophone
item.description:
Summary

  • Dr. Doot beat Slave Knight Gael in Dark Souls 3 using a saxophone at soul level 1.
  • Slave Knight Gael is one of the toughest bosses in Dark Souls 3 due to his quick combos and high damage.
  • Players have a history of completing challenges in FromSoftware games using musical instruments.

A dedicated Dark Souls 3 player managed to defeat one of the game's most difficult fights with nothing more than a saxophone. Streamer Dr. Doot shared their accomplishment early Monday morning, revealing they had finally defeated Slave Knight Gael while using a digital saxophone as their controller, proving once again just how passionate and persistent the Dark Souls 3 and FromSoftware communities alike can be.

Released back in 2016, Dark Souls 3 still seems to have a grasp on the video game industry, acting as presumably the final entry in FromSoftware's monumental Dark Souls franchise. Dark Souls 3 marked an exciting new starting point for the series, though it featured multiple beats, locations, and bosses that felt nostalgic for longtime fans. Dark Souls 3 notably kicked things up a notch with its bosses, featuring some of the toughest fights in the entire franchise. While Dark Souls 3 's final fight was intense, another one of the game's endgame bosses proved to be a sticking point for many, though one player prevailed using nothing more than a musical instrument.

Streamer Dr. Doot managed to defeat Slave Knight Gael live while using a digital saxophone. While this achievement is incredibly impressive in its own right, Dr. Doot was also at soul level 1, meaning they did not level up any of their stats during the run. These types of runs are quite common in Dark Souls games as well as FromSoftware's entire catalog, though it's far rarer for players to use a saxophone as their input source.

Dark Souls 3 Streamer Beats Slave Knight Gael with Saxophone

Slave Knight Gale is one of Dark Souls 3 's most infamous bosses, added as part of the game's Ashes of Ariandel DLC expansion. Dark Souls 3 features a number of challenging fights, but as mentioned earlier, Slave Knight Gael remains one of the game's toughest. His quick combos and immense damage make him a tough fight, even if players have leveled their stamina, health, and other attributes. This isn't the first time a player has conquered a FromSoftware boss or title using a musical instrument, with Elden Ring' s build variety allowing for all kinds of challenge runs to be possible.

FromSoftware recently announced a new standalone Elden Ring title that will be released next year. E lden Ring: Nightreign is a bold new adventure that puts heavy emphasis on multiplayer and co-op play, pitting three players against both new and seemingly old foes in a rogue-like setting.

item.title: Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 Pack is 'Basically Free'
item.description:
Summary

  • The Hella Fresh Starter Pack in Black Ops 6 has a large COD Point bonus.
  • Players can get the cosmetic pack for $4.99 - the same price as 500 COD Points.
  • It also includes 500 COD Points, making the included cosmetics essentially free for any player planning to buy the points anyway.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 players have noticed that one pack in the game's store has a big COD Points bonus. Ultimately, this makes the contents of the Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 pack essentially free on top of the value of the COD Points.

Since the release of Black Ops 6 back in October, Treyarch has been constantly adding new cosmetic packs to the store, from Operators to weapon skins and everything in between. While most of the earlier Operator skins hinted that the game may be taking a more grounded approach to previous Call of Duty games, Treyarch has since dashed this hope. Black Ops 6 has seen plenty of wild skins come to the store already, and the game is showing no signs of this slowing down in the future, with things like a Squid Game 2 collaboration on the way in the coming months.

Redditor VanillaChurr-oh pointed out that the Hella Fresh Starter Pack in the Black Ops 6 store includes 500 COD Points. In the game's store, 500 COD Points costs $4.99. However, the Hella Fresh Starter Pack also costs $4.99. This means that players get the COD Points, with the rest of the pack's contents coming essentially free. This is well worth taking advantage of for any player who was planning on buying COD Points anyway. There's no guarantee this pack will be in the store forever, so players should pick it up while it's still available.

Black Ops 6's Hella Fresh Starter Pack Includes Big COD Points Bonus

In terms of what the Hella Fresh Starter Pack actually includes, there's plenty on offer here. For $4.99 (on top of 500 COD Points), players receive:

  • Bout It Marshall Operator Skin
  • Bling Bling Kompakt 92 Weapon Blueprint
  • Scrub 9MM PM Weapon Blueprint
  • Fresh N' Fly Weapon Charm
  • Mongoose King Loading Screen
  • Golden Boots Weapon Sticker
  • Funky Fresh Spray
  • 1 Hour Double XP token

For most, the Weapon Blueprints and Black Ops 6 Operator skin will be the star attraction here. The colors of the Hella Fresh Starter Pack are extremely bold, which fits right in with many of the existing cosmetics featured in Black Ops 6 .

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 players have a lot to enjoy over the holiday season. The Archie's Festival Frenzy Christmas event remains ongoing, while Double XP is returning to Black Ops 6 on Christmas Eve. This should give existing players the motivation to hop on and defeat some Christmas newbies, while fresh players have the opportunity to play catch-up on the route to Prestige Master.

item.title: XDefiant's Assassin's Creed Faction May Be Too Little Too Late
item.description:
Ubisoft, the French publisher behind Assassin's Creed and Far Cry , released a multiplayer-only first-person shooter called XDefiant earlier this year. Dubbed a " Call of Duty killer" by some, the game got off to a pretty strong start across all the platforms it was released on. It garnered 1 million unique players in just two and a half hours, and became Ubisoft's fastest-played game of all time, an impressive feat for a free-to-play title like this one. XDefiant was even one of the top 10 most-played games on PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series X/S in the month of its release, beating out evergreen titles like Rainbow Six: Siege and Roblox .

The success of XDefiant didn't last long, however. By August 2024, rumors began to circulate that Ubisoft was considering shutting down its newly-released FPS due to a dramatic decline in concurrent player counts. While some developers at the company fervently denied these claims, they were ultimately proven true in December that year. Indeed, Ubisoft officially confirmed that XDefiant would be shuttered in June 2025, only a year after its initial launch. Development for the game would be discontinued as well, Ubisoft said, but its then-upcoming third season would be launched as initially planned. After it was finally released on December 18, XDefiant Season 3 received positive feedback from fans, but it arguably came out at far too late a time to make a noticeable impact.

XDefiant's Assassin's Creed Update is Arriving At the Wrong Time

XDefiant's Season 3 is Overstuffed With New Content

XDefiant 's third and final season is significantly larger in scope than the game's previous updates because it includes content that would've been included in subsequent seasons. This patch is primarily themed around a new faction called the Assassins. Inspired by the titular characters from Assassin's Creed , the Assassins give players a more tactical approach to combat. Players who select the Assassin faction in a given playthrough will have access to various abilities, such as the Hidden Blade, Cherry Bomb, Eagle Vision, and Apple of Eden.

Hidden Blades allow players to kill enemies with one melee hit, and Cherry Bombs knock out targets in a selected location. Eagle Vision, meanwhile, gives users the ability to track down their enemies, while Apple of Eden grants players the option to teleport next to other players for a limited time.

In addition to the Assassins, the final update for XDefiant includes two other factions, one of which is based on the Wolves from Tom Clancy's Ghost Recon: Breakpoint , while the other is inspired by the Omega Force from Far Cry 3: Blood Dragon . Season 3 also brings with it a bucketload of new arenas, modes, progression systems, cosmetics, and bug fixes, too many to list in just a few paragraphs. One of the biggest highlights of the update, though, is the Enchanted Forest map, which has an entire collectathon-inspired mode that pays tribute to Rayman Legends .

Some of the New Content Ubisoft Added to XDefiant Should've Been Released Earlier

Considering how much content is packed into XDefiant 's third season, it's evident that the FPS wasn't meant to be closed down anytime soon. Ubisoft's decision to shutter XDefiant and delist it from all digital storefronts without warning (thus making XDefiant inaccessible to those who hadn't previously downloaded it) is a major disappointment, especially for those that had hoped the " Call of Duty killer" would have lasted for a longer period of time.

The developers at Ubisoft clearly had a lot of passion for XDefiant , as the high-quality content in Season 3 indicates, but perhaps they should have released some of these features at an earlier date. If XDefiant really was struggling so badly in the months after its launch, then maybe Ubisoft should've added a portion of the content from Season 3 beforehand to resuscitate interest in the game. Instead, the publisher decided to abandon the first-person shooter without giving it one more chance. It's unfortunate how the situation unfolded for XDefiant , but at least fans can enjoy its new content before it gets shut down next year.

item.title: God Of War Ragnarok: Best Relics, Ranked
item.description:
God of War Ragnarok features 14 relics that each has a unique advantage to players who want to see further versatility and power when it comes to the game's engaging combat. The best relics in God of War Ragnarok will offer some incredible sources of power, from increasing damage output, stopping time itself, and even discovering unseen secret minibosses.

If players want to create the strongest Kratos in God of War Ragnarok , then finding the best relics and knowing just what they do to aid in battle is going to take them a long way, and potentially save Kratos and Atreus from Fimbulwinter in any difficulty and New Game Plus.

Updated on December 23, 2024, by Jake Fillery: The best Relic in God of War Ragnarok may be dependent on everyone's unique playstyle, but there are some far superior options out there for Kratos to wield to kill the Norse Mythology that threaten him and Atreus. If players want to know the best God of War Ragnarok Relic, then they are going to need to know them all, their stats, and where to get them so that they can become the efficient and deadly god of war.

14 Mystical Heirloom

Found Behind an Ice Wall in The Lake of Nine, Midgard, With the Draupnir Spear

  • Awakens slumbering bosses.
  • Cooldown: 16 seconds
  • Upgrades: cannot be upgraded.

The Mystical Heirloom serves no purpose in combat and is used mainly to find secret bosses within the Nine Realms. If players have ever seen a statue of a troll or a dragon, they can actually be awakened by using the Mystical Heirloom next to it. There are four total bosses found with the Mystical Heirloom:

  • Dragon Beach, East of the Bay of Bounty, Svartalfheim
  • Noatun's Garden, Vanaheim
  • The Forbidden Sands, Alfheim
  • The Derelict Outpost, Midgard

Once all four of these minibosses have been found and defeated, the Mystical Heirloom is useless.

13 Hilt of Hrotti

Reward For Defeating the Second Oath Guard Miniboss in The Plains, Vanaheim

  • Applies a mark to nearby enemies. Attacking a marked enemy reduces Runic Cooldowns of the equipped weapon. Killing a marked enemy grants a Blessing of Runic.
  • Cooldown: 142 seconds

item.title: Genshin Impact Fans Aren't Happy About Mavuika and Citlali Decision
item.description:
Summary

  • Genshin Impact players anticipate Mavuika's arrival, only to be disappointed by the shared banner with Citlali.
  • Fans question the revenue logic behind launching two characters simultaneously.

Genshin Impact players don't seem too happy with the schedule for some of the upcoming character releases. With the release of the Natlan region, Genshin Impact 's playable roster continues to expand, with the five-star Anemo user Chasca and the four-star support Ororon being the most recent additions.

While all the Natlan updates so far have included new playable characters, many players are still eagerly awaiting the arrival of Mavuika, the famous Pyro Archon. Genshin Impact 's main storyline is primarily explored through the Archon Chapters, which always feature one of Teyvat's leaders in the spotlight.

So far, Genshin Impact has introduced six of the seven Archons, with Snezhnaya being the only region yet to have its Archon make an official in-game appearance. After months of anticipation, the recently held Special Program for Genshin Impact Version 5.3 finally confirmed that Mavuika will be featured in the upcoming update. However, the livestream also revealed that Mavuika will share a banner with another new five-star character, the Cryo user Citlali—a decision many fans found disappointing. Typically, when two new characters are introduced in the same update, their releases are staggered across the two banner cycles. This approach allows players to evaluate both characters thoroughly before deciding to spend their Primogems and offers additional time to collect resources for the second banner.

Genshin Impact 5.3: Why Are Mavuika and Citlali Being Released Simultaneously?

Some fans have noted that, from a revenue perspective, pairing Mavuika with another roster addition doesn't make sense, as she would draw significant attention on her own. One possible reason for this decision could be that the second part of the update seems reserved for the Lantern Rite Festival, which is arguably the largest annual event in Genshin Impact after the release of a new major region.

The Special Program revealed that players would receive numerous rewards during the event, including a free four-star character from Liyue. Additionally, Genshin Impact 's new four-star character, Lan Yan, will be available for free during this limited event. Many fans argue that it doesn’t make sense for HoYoverse to offer free pulls in the second half of the update when Mavuika and Citlali are featured in the first banner cycle.

Previous rumors suggested that future updates might feature Limited Banners lasting the entire update duration, approximately 42 days. However, this scenario seems unlikely since most of HoYoverse’s titles follow similar banner schedules. Fans speculate that a more practical solution would be introducing three playable units per banner cycle, as the roster has grown so large that some five-star characters in Genshin Impact occasionally go over 500 days without a re-run.
